Docs.summary: Action that requests to go to the next entity in this node's text at a given movement granularity.

remarks.para: Action that requests to go to the next entity in this node's text at a given movement granularity. For example, move to the next character, word, etc.

Arguments:
Example: Move to the previous character and do not extend selection.

Docs.summary: Action to move to the next HTML element of a given type.

remarks.para: Action to move to the next HTML element of a given type. For example, move to the BUTTON, INPUT, TABLE, etc.

Docs.summary: Action that requests to go to the previous entity in this node's text at a given movement granularity.

remarks.para: Action that requests to go to the previous entity in this node's text at a given movement granularity. For example, move to the next character, word, etc.

Arguments:
Example: Move to the next character and do not extend selection.

Docs.summary: Action to move to the previous HTML element of a given type.

remarks.para: Action to move to the previous HTML element of a given type. For example, move to the BUTTON, INPUT, TABLE, etc.

A virtual descendant is an imaginary View that is reported as a part of the view hierarchy for accessibility purposes. This enables custom views that draw complex content to report them selves as a tree of virtual views, thus conveying their logical structure.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class Android.Support.V4.View.Accessibility.AccessibilityNodeInfoCompat> FindAccessibilityNodeInfosByText(string text) cil managed

Docs.summary: Finds s by text.

remarks.para: Finds s by text. The match is case insensitive containment. The search is relative to this info i.e. this info is the root of the traversed tree.
Note: It is a client responsibility to recycle the received info by calling to avoid creating of multiple instances.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
